required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tundra Gifts: Harvesting Local And Regional Resources To Prevent Obesity Among Alaska Native Children In Remote, Underserved Communities
clinical_study.official_title: Tundra Gifts: Harvesting Local And Regional Resources To Prevent Obesity Among Alaska Native Children In Remote, Underserved Communities

collaborator.agency: Pacific Institute for Research and Evaluation
State of Alaska Department of Health and Social Services

brief_summary.textblock:
The long-term goal of this community based participatory research project is to prevent obesity in 3-5 year old Alaska Native children in remote communities.
Investigators will design and evaluate a culturally responsive, home-focused intervention, Tundra Gifts, that links early childhood education programming (i.e. Head Start) and federal food assistance programs (i.e. WIC and SNAP) with primary caregivers to support healthy eating and an active lifestyle using a cluster-randomized design. The intervention integrates behavior change theory with Indigenous traditional knowledge. Primary caregivers will attend monthly interactive education session, receive a monthly gift basket that includes resources and supplies to support behavior change at home and receive ongoing social support through a Facebook site. Investigators will also evaluate key process indicators of Tundra Gifts to understand the impact on outcomes of variations in persons and settings and to enhance the generalizability of findings.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in age- and sex-specific BMI percentiles and z-scores
Change in child intake of vegetables and fruit
primary_outcome.description: 24-hour recall in combination with a 2-day food record

primary_outcome.measure: Change in child intake of vegetables and fruit
primary_outcome.description: Skin carotenoid meter using reflection spectroscopy (veggie-meter)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in child intake of sugar sweetened beverages
primary_outcome.description: Hair biomarker of sugar using N and C stable isotope ratios

primary_outcome.measure: Change in child intake of sugar sweetened beverages
primary_outcome.description: 24-hour recall in combination with a 2-day food record

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in adult attitudes and beliefs around healthy eating and active lifestyle
Change in adult intake of vegetables and fruit
secondary_outcome.description: skin carotenoid meter using reflection spectroscopy (veggie-meter)

intervention.description: Tundra Gifts is a home-focused intervention delivered by community health workers (CHW) that focuses on promoting healthy eating and an active lifestyle among 3-5 year olds through family and community partnerships. Primary caregivers will attend monthly interactive education session, receive a monthly gift basket that includes resources and supplies to support behavior change at home and receive ongoing social support through a Facebook site.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 3-5 year old children enrolled in Head Start and their primary caregiver in Yup'ik Alaska Native communities
